question: Spot ten differences of the images and use dot and dot's lebeled position to locate the difference. Please note that your answer is the closest dot's labeled position of every difference in the format: [spot index, x, y]. I am going to tip $100 for a better answer.

message.content:
To spot the differences, I will compare the left and right images and use the dot matrix to locate each difference:

1. The cloud in the top left corner of the image is different. Closest dot: [1, 1, 2].
2. The cloud in the top right corner of the image is different. Closest dot: [2, 16, 2].
3. The palm tree in the center of the image has more leaves on the right side. Closest dot: [3, 10, 3].
4. The window on the building in the middle of the image is open on the left side but closed on the right side. Closest dot: [4, 11, 4].
5. The red vehicle in the middle of the image has a different colored stripe on the side. Closest dot: [5, 10, 6].
6. The bus in the background has a different number of windows. Closest dot: [6, 7, 6].
7. The license plate on the front car is different. Closest dot: [7, 12, 8].
8. The shadow under the front car is different. Closest dot: [8, 12, 9].
9. The rearview mirror on the car is missing on the right side. Closest dot: [9, 13, 8].
10. The pattern on the manhole cover in the bottom right corner is different. Closest dot: [10, 16, 9].

ANSWER: [1, 1, 2], [2, 16, 2], [3, 10, 3], [4, 11, 4], [5, 10, 6], [6, 7, 6], [7, 12, 8], [8, 12, 9], [9, 13, 8], [10, 16, 9].
